sen.j: 天橋立駅（あまのはしだてえき）は、京都府宮津市字文珠にある、北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Aza-Monju of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, Amanohashidate Station is a stop on the Miyazu Line, a Kitakinki Tango Railway Line.
Amanohashidate Station, located in Aza-Monju of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
Amanohashidate Station, located in Aza-Monju of Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Miyazu Line of the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: 日本三景の一つに数えられ、全国的に有名な観光地、天橋立への鉄道での玄関口である。
sen.e: Enumerated as one of the three most famous panoramas of Japan and a tourist site renowned throughout the country, this station is the gateway railway station to Amanohashidate.
Counted as having one of the three most famous panoramas in Japan and a tourist site renowned throughout the country, it's the gateway railway station to Amanohashidate.
Counted as having one of the three most famous panoramas in Japan and a tourist site renowned throughout the country, it's the gateway railway station to Amanohashidate.

sen.j: また、2000年に、第1回近畿の駅百選にも選ばれている。
sen.e: Amanohashidate Station was also chosen as one of the 100 most attractive stations in the Kinki region at the first of such selections in 2000.
Amanohashidate Station was also chosen as one of the 100 most attractive stations in the Kinki region at the first of such selections in 2000.
Amanohashidate Station was also chosen as one of the 100 most attractive stations in the Kinki region at the first of such selections in 2000.

sen.j: 駅構造
島式・相対式2面3線のプラットホームと留置線2線を持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with a single one-sided platform (track on one side only) and an Island type platform between tracks and two storage tracks.
It is an aboveground station with a single one-sided platform (track on one side only), an island-type platform between tracks and two storage tracks.
It is an aboveground station with a single one-sided platform (track on one side only), an island-type platform between tracks and two storage tracks.

sen.j: 丹後半島北部に位置する、伊根町の舟屋を模した駅舎は、1991年に日本鉄道建築協会賞を受賞している。
sen.e: The station is located in the northern part of Tango Peninsula, its building simulates a traditional boat house of nearby Ine-cho and awarded the Association of Railway Architects Prize in 1991.
The station is located in the northern part of Tango Peninsula; its building simulates a traditional boathouse of nearby Ine-cho and was awarded the Association of Railway Architects Prize in 1991.
The station is located in the northern part of Tango Peninsula; its building simulates a traditional boathouse of nearby Ine-cho and was awarded the Association of Railway Architects Prize in 1991.

sen.j: 駅構内に観光案内所あり。
sen.e: A tourist information center is set up within station premises.
A tourist information center is located within the station premises.
A tourist information center is located within the station premises.

sen.j: また、第三セクターの鉄道駅としては珍しく、みどりの窓口がある点も特筆される。
sen.e: Again, rather uncommon for a railway station operated by joint private-public management, its having a JT Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi) is worthy of mention.
Again, in a manner uncommon for a railway station operated by joint private-public management, its having a JT Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi) is worthy of mention.
Again, in a manner uncommon for a railway station operated by joint private-public management, it's significant in that it has a JR Ticket Office (Midori-no-madoguchi).

sen.j: しかし、バリアフリーの設備は一切ない。
sen.e: However, facilities of this station are totally non-barrier-free.
However, facilities of this station are totally non-barrier-free.
However, facilities of this station are totally non-barrier-free.

sen.j: 利用状況
2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約496人である。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station was approximately 496 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: “約”でなく“平均”と思われます。
sen.e: The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 496 per day in fiscal 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 496 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
年間を通して観光利用の大変多い駅であるが、夏の海水浴シーズンになると、特に海水浴客で大賑わいとなり、この時は駅員を増配置して対応している。
sen.e: This is a station where a large number of tourists get off throughout the year, but when the summer sea bathing season sets in, sea bathers especially gather in flocks and it is then when additional station staffs are assigned to cope with the congested situation

This is a station where large numbers of tourists disembark throughout the year, but when the summer sea bathing season gets underway, bathers gather in flocks; accordingly, additional station staff are assigned to cope with the congestion.

This is a station where large numbers of tourists disembark throughout the year, but when the summer sea bathing season gets underway, bathers gather in flocks; accordingly, additional station staff are assigned to cope with the congestion.

sen.j: 駅周辺
天橋立（当駅下車、徒歩すぐ）
sen.e: Amanohashidate (short distance walk from this station.)
Amanohashidate is a short walk from this station.
Amanohashidate (within a short walking distance from this station)
sen.cmt: 修正前の翻訳の表現が適切と判断し、戻しました。

sen.j: 天橋立温泉「智恵の湯」（当駅 駅前）
sen.e: Asmanohashidate Hot Spring 'Chieno-Yu' (in front of this station)
Asmanohashidate Hot Spring 'Chieno-Yu' (in front of this station)
Amanohashidate Hot Spring 'Chieno-Yu' (in front of this station)

sen.j: 天橋立海水浴場
天橋立公園（当駅から、徒歩）
sen.e: Amanohashidate Park (within walking distance from this station)
Amanohashidate Park (within walking distance from this station)
Amanohashidate Park (within walking distance from this station)

sen.j: 天橋立ビューランド
智恩寺 (宮津市)
橋立ホテル
玄妙庵（皇族方が宿泊になられた旅館）
sen.e: Genmyoan Inn (the Imperial Family stayed at this Japanese-style inn)

sen.j: バス
丹後海陸交通
加悦フェローライン
タクシー
京都タクシー宮津営業所
sen.e: Kyoto Taxi Co., Ltd. Miyazu Office
Kyoto Taxi Co., Ltd. Miyazu Office
Kyoto Taxi Co., Ltd. Miyazu Office

sen.j: 日本交通 (福知山市)
歴史
1925年（大正14年）7月31日 - 日本国有鉄道峰山線の宮津～丹後山田（現・野田川）間の開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated July 31, 1925 simultaneously with Japanese National Railways commencing operation of the Miyazu and Tango-Yamada (now Nodagawa) section on the Mineyama Line.
It was inaugurated July 31, 1925 simultaneously with Japanese National Railways commencement of operation of the Miyazu and Tango-Yamada (now Nodagawa) section on the Mineyama Line.
July 31, 1925: The station was inaugurated simultaneously with Japan National Railways commencement of operation between the Miyazu and Tango-Yamada (now Nodagawa) section on the Mineyama Line.

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）8月10日 - 路線名改称により国鉄宮津線の駅に。
sen.e: Became a Japan National Railways Miyazu Line station on Aug. 10, 1932 from renaming of the Line.
It became a Japan National Railways Miyazu Line station on Aug. 10, 1932, when the line was renamed.
August 10, 1932: The station became a Japan National Railways Miyazu Line station when the line was renamed.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a West Japan Railway Company (JR West) station from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日 - 北近畿タンゴ鉄道への宮津線移管により、同鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kitakinki Tango Railway station on April 1, 1990 from control of Miyazu Line being transferred to Kitakinki Tango Railway.
It became a Kitakinki Tango Railway station on April 1, 1990, when the control of the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway.
April 1, 1990: The station became a Kitakinki Tango Railway station when the control of the Miyazu Line was transferred to the Kitakinki Tango Railway.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）7月 - 現在の駅舎に改築される。
sen.e: Station building reconstructed as it stands today in July, 1990.
Station building reconstructed as it stands today in July 1990.
July 1990: The station building was reconstructed as it stands today.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月16日 - 宮津～当駅間が電化。
sen.e: Electrification of Miyazu Station-Amanohashidate Station section of the Line completed March 16, 1996.
Electrification of Miyazu Station-Amanohashidate Station section of the Line completed March 16, 1996.
March 16, 1996: Electrification of Miyazu Station-Amanohashidate Station section of the line was completed.

sen.j: JR西日本の電車特急（はしだて・文殊）が運転開始。
sen.e: Limited express Hashidate and Monju of JR-West commence operations.
Limited express Hashidate and Monju of JR-West commence operations.
The limited express trains Hashidate and Monju of JR West commenced operations.
sen.cmt: trains 追加 JR Westとしました

sen.e: Miyazu Station - Amanohashidate Station - Iwataki-guchi Station
